app.text_info: This app is based on crowdsourcing. As you can see, it's also free of charge. Please let us know if you want to contribute with your experience, enrich the content, correct inaccuracies, or submit pictures.
app.text_acknowledge: This quick app is an open-source project powered by open data and enriched by the community. Most of the information was extracted from Wikidata, OpenStreetMaps, and other public sources. You can find inaccuracies, so we apologize in advance.
app.text_feedback: Please let us know if you want to contribute with your experience, enrich the content, correct inaccuracies, or submit pictures.

pois.name: Asklepion
pois.description: Asklepion is an ancient healing center dedicated to Asclepius, the god of medicine.
pois.more: It was one of the most renowned healing centers in the ancient world and attracted visitors seeking treatment and spiritual healing. The site features impressive architectural remains, including a temple, a theater, and thermal baths.

pois.name: Kos Town Castle
pois.description: Kos Town Castle is a medieval fortress located in the heart of Kos Town.
pois.more: Built by the Knights of Saint John in the 14th century, the castle served as a defensive structure to protect the town. Visitors can explore the castle's walls, towers, and enjoy panoramic views of the town and the Aegean Sea.
attributions: Image under CC BY-SA 4.0 on Wikimedia Commons: Rikki Mitterer
Image under CC BY-SA 3.0 on Wikimedia Commons: ich selbst

pois.name: Hippocrates Tree
pois.description: The Hippocrates Ancient Plane Tree is a famous landmark located in Kos Town.
pois.more: According to legend, this tree was planted by Hippocrates, the ancient Greek physician and the father of medicine. It is a symbol of his teachings and attracts visitors who seek a connection to the history of medicine.
attributions: Image under CC BY-SA 3.0 on Wikimedia Commons: Steven Fruitsmaak

pois.name: Ancient Agora of Kos
pois.description: The Ancient Agora of Kos is an archaeological site in Kos Town.
pois.more: It was the central marketplace and social hub in ancient times. Visitors can explore the ruins of the ancient buildings, including stoas, temples, and statues, and get a glimpse into the vibrant life of the ancient city.
attributions: Image under CC0 on Wikimedia Commons: Karelj

pois.name: Ancient Gymnasium of Kos
pois.description: The Ancient Gymnasium of Kos is an archaeological site located in Kos Town.
pois.more: It was a place where ancient Greeks engaged in physical exercises, sports, and educational activities. The site consists of open-air courtyards, exercise areas, and various buildings. Visitors can explore the remains of the gymnasium and learn about the importance of physical education in ancient times.
attributions: Image under CC0 on Wikimedia Commons: Karelj

pois.name: Kos Marina
pois.description: Kos Marina is a vibrant harbor located in the heart of Kos Town.
pois.more: It is a popular destination for yacht owners and offers a range of facilities and services. Visitors can enjoy waterfront dining, stroll along the promenade, and soak in the scenic views of the marina, boats, and the Aegean Sea.

pois.name: Kos Archaeological Museum
pois.description: The Kos Archaeological Museum is a museum located in Kos Town.
pois.more: It houses a rich collection of archaeological artifacts from the island of Kos, including sculptures, pottery, and mosaics. The museum provides insights into the island's ancient history and showcases the artistic and cultural heritage of Kos.
attributions: Image under CC BY-SA 2.5 on Wikimedia Commons by Rmrfstar

pois.name: Hippocratic Museum
pois.description: Museum about the Hippocratic Foundation of Kos
pois.more: Its exhibits display the history of the Hippocratic Foundation of Kos, which is dedicated to transmitting knowledge about Hippocrates, as well as founding hospitals and institutes. The ancient Greek physician Hippocrates is believed to have been born there. The displays include some literature about the Hippocratic medicine.

pois.name: Casa Romana
pois.description: Casa Romana is a Roman villa located in Kos Town.
pois.more: This well-preserved archaeological site showcases a luxurious Roman residence from the 2nd century AD. Visitors can explore the various rooms, courtyards, and mosaic floors, and get a glimpse into the lifestyle of the wealthy inhabitants of ancient Kos.

pois.name: Therma Beach
pois.description: Therma Beach is a unique natural hot spring located near Kos Town.
pois.more: The beach is known for its warm, therapeutic waters that originate from volcanic activity. Visitors can relax in the natural hot springs, enjoy the picturesque surroundings, and experience the rejuvenating properties of the mineral-rich waters.

pois.name: Hippocrates Square
pois.description: Hippocrates Square is a central square in Kos Town, named after the famous physician Hippocrates.
pois.more: Surrounded by charming cafes, restaurants, and shops, the square is a vibrant hub of activity. It features a statue of Hippocrates and serves as a gathering place for locals and visitors to relax, socialize, and enjoy the lively atmosphere.
attributions: Image under CC BY 3.0 on Wikimedia Commons by Steven Fruitsmaak

pois.name: Nisyros Island
pois.description: Nisyros Island is a volcanic island located near Kos.
pois.more: Known for its unique volcanic landscapes and stunning natural beauty, Nisyros Island offers visitors an opportunity to explore volcanic craters, geothermal springs, and picturesque villages. The island is accessible by ferry from Kos and is a popular day trip destination for nature lovers and hikers.
attributions: Images under CC BY-SA 3.0 Unported on Wikimedia Commons by Mike1979 Russia

pois.name: Tigaki Beach
pois.description: Tigaki Beach is a popular sandy beach located in the village of Tigaki.
pois.more: With its crystal-clear waters and golden sand, Tigaki Beach is a popular spot for sunbathing, swimming, and water sports. The beach is well-organized with sunbeds, umbrellas, and beachfront taverns, offering visitors a relaxing and enjoyable seaside experience.
attributions: Images under CC BY-SA 2.0 on Wikimedia Commons by Andy Mitchell

pois.name: Kos Natural Park
pois.description: Kos Natural Park is a protected area located in the northern part of the island.
pois.more: Covering a diverse range of habitats including wetlands, forests, and sand dunes, Kos Natural Park is home to a variety of plant and animal species. Visitors can explore the park through walking trails, observe bird species, and enjoy the tranquility of nature.

pois.name: Agios Fokas Beach
pois.description: Agios Fokas Beach is a picturesque pebble beach located near Kos Town.
pois.more: With its crystal-clear waters and natural beauty, Agios Fokas Beach offers visitors a peaceful and serene atmosphere. The beach is known for its calming vibes and stunning views of the Aegean Sea. It is an ideal spot for relaxation, swimming, and enjoying the beautiful coastal scenery.

pois.name: Lido Water Park
pois.description: Lido Water Park is a family-friendly water park located in Mastichari, Kos
pois.more: The park offers a wide range of water slides, pools, and attractions suitable for all ages. Visitors can enjoy thrilling rides, relax in the sun, and have fun in the water. It's a perfect place to cool off and enjoy a day of aquatic entertainment.

pois.name: Plaka Forest
pois.description: Plaka Forest is a natural forest located in the southeastern part of Kos.
pois.more: Covering an area of lush greenery and diverse flora, Plaka Forest is a haven for nature enthusiasts. Visitors can explore the forest through hiking trails, enjoy peaceful picnics, and admire the natural beauty of the surroundings. The forest is home to various plant species and offers a serene escape from the bustling city.

pois.name: Agios Stefanos Beach
pois.description: Agios Stefanos Beach is a beautiful sandy beach located in Kefalos, Kos.
pois.more: With its crystal-clear turquoise waters and soft golden sand, Agios Stefanos Beach offers visitors a picturesque seaside experience. The beach is surrounded by stunning cliffs and offers panoramic views of the Aegean Sea. Visitors can relax under umbrellas, swim in the refreshing waters, and enjoy the natural beauty of the coastal landscape.

pois.name: Cavo Paradiso Beach
pois.description: Cavo Paradiso Beach is a scenic beach located on the southern coast of Kos.
pois.more: With its pristine waters, soft sand, and tranquil atmosphere, Cavo Paradiso Beach offers a peaceful retreat away from the crowds. Visitors can unwind on the beach, swim in the azure waters, and enjoy the stunning views of the Aegean Sea. The beach is surrounded by natural beauty and provides a serene environment for relaxation and sunbathing.

pois.name: Antimachia Castle
pois.description: Antimachia Castle is a medieval fortress located in the village of Antimachia, Kos.
pois.more: The castle dates back to the Byzantine period and offers a glimpse into the island's rich history. Visitors can explore the ruins of the castle, walk along the battlements, and enjoy panoramic views of the surrounding countryside. The site provides a fascinating insight into the island's past and offers a picturesque setting for exploration.

pois.name: Zia Village
pois.description: Zia Village is a picturesque mountain village located on the slopes of Mount Dikeos.
pois.more: Known for its charming traditional houses, narrow streets, and panoramic views, Zia Village offers visitors a glimpse into the authentic Greek island life. The village is renowned for its stunning sunsets, traditional taverns serving local cuisine, and handicraft shops selling handmade souvenirs. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely stroll through the village, savor delicious Greek dishes, and soak in the breathtaking vistas.
attributions: Images under CC BY-SA 4.0 on Wikimedia Commons by Rob Koster

pois.name: Paradise Beach
pois.description: Paradise Beach is a stunning sandy beach located on the southwestern coast of Kos.
pois.more: With its crystal-clear waters, soft golden sand, and lush surroundings, Paradise Beach lives up to its name. The beach is known for its natural beauty and offers a tranquil atmosphere for relaxation and sunbathing. Visitors can enjoy swimming in the refreshing waters, unwind on the beach loungers, and take in the breathtaking coastal scenery.
attributions: Image under CC BY-SA 2.0 by Michal Osmenda

pois.name: Tingaki Salt Lake
pois.description: Tingaki Salt Lake is a natural salt lake located near Tingaki village in Kos.
pois.more: The salt lake is a significant habitat for various bird species and a popular spot for birdwatching enthusiasts. Visitors can observe a diverse range of birdlife, including flamingos, herons, and sandpipers. The serene environment and the scenic beauty of the lake make it an ideal place for nature lovers and photography enthusiasts.

pois.name: Hippocrates Garden Cultural Center
pois.description: The Hippocrates Garden Cultural Center is an educational and cultural complex in Mastichari, Kos.
pois.more: The center is dedicated to preserving the teachings and heritage of Hippocrates, the ancient Greek physician. It offers interactive exhibits, herb gardens, and educational programs about traditional medicine and holistic healing. Visitors can learn about the medicinal properties of herbs, participate in workshops, and explore the beautiful gardens.

pois.name: Alasarna Archaeological
pois.description: The Temple of Apollo is considered to be the island’s most ancient temple and second in richness after the Asklepieion
pois.more: It links the city of Alasarna to the cult of Apollo which is older than that of Asklepios. The Bavarian archaeologist Ludwig Ross was the first to identify the archaeological site with the ancient town of Alasarna.

pois.name: Charmilos' Grave
pois.description: The Tomb of Harmylos
pois.more: The Tomb of Harmylos is, in fact, a family mausoleum with 12 graves, 6 symmetrically enclosed on the walls on each site of a narrow corridor. The monument dates from the Hellenistic period and is presumably the family crypt of Harmylos, a local hero, and creator of the regal lineage of Harmylians.

pois.name: Old Spring Water
pois.description: Pyli Spring called Pigi is a six-fountain spring situated in the Peripatos (or Agios Nikolaos) area of the village of Pyli
pois.more: It was restored in 1592 during the Ottoman occupation, as stated on a built-in marble inscription. Water spurts out of six nozzles most of which stick out of the mouth of sculptures of a lion’s head.
